Ideal: Greater Good. Our lot is to lay down our lives in defense of others. (Good)
Bond: I would still lay down my life for the people I served with.
Flaw: The monstrous enemy we faced in battle still leaves me quivering with fear.

Equipment: Trophy taken from a fallen enemy(Dagge, broken blade, piece of a banner)
PersonalityTrait: I’m haunted by memories o fw ar. I can’t get the images of violence out of my mind.
Ideal: Responsibility. I do what I must and obey just authority. (Lawful)
Bond: Someone saved my life on the battlefield. To this day,  will never leave a friend behind.
Flaw: I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.

Equipment: Set of bone dice or dock of cards
PersonalityTrait: I’ve lost too many friends, and I’m slow to make new ones.
Ideal: Independence. When people follow orders blindly, they embrace a kind of tyranny. (Chaotic)
Flaw: I made a terrible mistake in battle cost many lives—and I would do anything to keep that mistake secret.

PersonalityTrait: I’m full of inspiring and cautionary tales from my military experience relevant to almost every combat situation.
Ideal: Might. In life as in war, the stronger force wins. (Evil)
Bond: I’ll never forget the crushing defeat my company suffered or the enemies who dealt it.
Flaw: My hatred of my enemies is blind and unreasoning.

PersonalityTrait: I can stare down a hell hound without flinching.
Ideal: Live and Let Live. Ideals aren’t worth killing over or going to war for. (Neutral)
Bond: Those who fight beside me are those worth dying for.
Flaw: I obey the law, even if the law causes misery.

PersonalityTrait: I enjoy being strong and like breaking things.
Ideal: Nation. My city, nation, or people are all that matter.(Any)
Bond: I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.
Flaw: I’d rather eat my armor than admit when I’m wrong.

PersonalityTrait: I have a crude sense of humor.
I face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success.
